content.description: This Way to Tasty has good rock quality. Three different people will climb this route three different ways.
content.location: From the cave, walk west along the base and slightly downhill (~100’).

content.description: Hopefully the bite of this two-move crux won’t leave a mark. Ascend the steepening ramp, and step right into the underclings to tiptoe through the overlap. Enjoy the cruise above.
content.protection: About 8 bolts and a top anchor.
content.location: Start from the base area at the left side of the cave. Currently this is the 3rd route left of the cave.

content.description: Protecting with gear on a short undercling section with thin feet leads to easier climbing above. A the top, you can use one or two pieces of thin gear.
content.protection: Gear to ~2” plus 6 bolts and an anchor.
content.location: Start at base area left of the cave.

content.description: Rabid Rock Chuck starts from the perched ramp at the left side of the crag and is currently 2 short pitches, about 55 feet each. The first pitch has highly featured rock ranging from contoured horns to pockets to thin cracks. The second pitch steps left and continues up the blocks and cracks to the top. The featured 5.9 face to the left of the first pitch is worth toproping.
content.protection: Mixed - 3 bolts, small to medium gear and slings, and top anchors at the top of each pitch.
content.location:
This route currently starts from the perched ramp at the left side of the crag, just left from the shady chimney area where

Happy Birthday Hantavirus

starts. From the ground level near

This Way to Tasty

, walk left, and angle up the wide ramp to the route.

climbs.name: Loose Block Croc
climbs.fa: Wilson McKay and Mitch Banaszak, summer 2021

content.description:
Ascend a large, left-facing dihedral to the left and uphill of

Rabid Rock Chuck

. Gear can be found both in the dihedral and in various cracks in the right face. Pull a small roof near the ground, then continue up a slab. After the dihedral peters out at about 80 feet, move left, and climb carefully across a large pile of loose, microwave-sized blocks. Continue about 20 feet up and right in order to belay your follower from the bolted anchor atop

Rabid Rock Chuck

.

Rappel

RRC

.
content.protection: Cams from a purple TCU to a #3 Camalot and nuts.

content.description: Little Bird Let Go is technical, balancy, and relatively continuous until the last 10-15 feet.
content.location: It is on a large panel of high angle slab to the right of a big dihedral. Currently, this is one of two routes on the far right side of the cliff, east of the cave approximately 200 feet.

content.description: There are two cruxes on this climb - one near the ground and one approximately halfway up. Varied movement on this moderate route keeps things interesting.
content.location: This is located on the far west side of the Death by Wildlife crag. Walking west along the base of the cliff from the main cave area, you will go up a short, steeper ramp and encounter a very wide chimney. This route is on your right before entering the chimney.

content.description: Too much fun is what that mean… prance up the crux of this one on small edges.
content.location: It is on a large panel of high angle slab to the right of a big dihedral. Currently, this is one of two routes on the far right side of the cliff, east of the cave approximately 200 feet.

climbs.name: Candiru Kisses
climbs.fa: D. Montgomery, R. Laird, H. Barbare

content.description: This route is 110 feet long! Plan accordingly.... It is a beautiful line with a wide variety of rock and cruxes. Start with the right-angling, technical moves, continue through the steep, bouldery section, and finish on the classic, hueco headwall.
content.protection: About 13 bolts, a top anchor, and a midway anchor. The midway anchor can be used to descend the route with a 60 meter rope.
content.location: Start on the orange rock about 100 feet right of the cave.

climbs.name: Bear Bait
climbs.fa: R. Laird, A. O'Neil, H. Barbare

content.description: Your belayer standing at the opening of the cave is the bait! Make some steep moves to gain the pocket and the horizontal crack. Plug some gear, and romp up the classic water streak above.
content.protection: Bring a light rack with gear to 2 inches. There are 4 bolts and a top anchor.
content.location: Start from the base area at the left side of the cave. Currently this is the 1st route left of the cave.
